sigma_rule.title: Security Eventlog Cleared
sigma_rule.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: RDP Login from Localhost
sigma_rule.description: RDP login with localhost source address may be a tunnelled login
sigma_rule.author: Thomas Patzke

sigma_rule.title: RDP Login from Localhost
sigma_rule.description: RDP login with localhost source address may be a tunnelled login
sigma_rule.author: Thomas Patzke

sigma_rule.title: Suspicious Plink Port Forwarding
sigma_rule.description: Detects suspicious Plink tunnel port forwarding to a local port
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Potential Remote Desktop Tunneling
sigma_rule.description: Detects potential use of an SSH utility to establish RDP over a reverse SSH Tunnel. This can be used by attackers to enable routing of network packets that would otherwise not reach their intended destination.
sigma_rule.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)

sigma_rule.title: Password Change on Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) Account
sigma_rule.description:
Detects potential attempts made to set the Directory Services Restore Mode administrator password.
The Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) account is a local administrator account on Domain Controllers.
Attackers may change the password in order to obtain persistence.
sigma_rule.author: Thomas Patzke

sigma_rule.title: Security Eventlog Cleared
sigma_rule.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Windows Default Domain GPO Modification
sigma_rule.description:
Detects modifications to Default Domain or Default Domain Controllers Group Policy Objects (GPOs).
Adversaries may modify these default GPOs to deploy malicious configurations across the domain.
sigma_rule.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

logsource.definition:
Enable 'Audit Directory Service Changes' in the Default Domain Controllers Policy under:
Computer Configuration -> Policies -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration -> Audit Policies -> DS Access -> Audit Directory Service Changes (Success).
Additionally, proper SACL needs to be configured on the 'CN=Policies,CN=System,DC=<domain>,DC=<tld>' container in Active Directory to capture changes to Group Policy Objects.

sigma_rule.title: Active Directory Replication from Non Machine Account
sigma_rule.description: Detects potential abuse of Active Directory Replication Service (ADRS) from a non machine account to request credentials.
sigma_rule.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

sigma_rule.title: Mimikatz DC Sync
sigma_rule.description: Detects Mimikatz DC sync security events
sigma_rule.author: Benjamin Delpy, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Scott Dermott, Sorina Ionescu

sigma_rule.title: HackTool - Mimikatz Kirbi File Creation
sigma_rule.description: Detects the creation of files created by mimikatz such as ".kirbi", "mimilsa.log", etc.
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), David ANDRE

sigma_rule.title: Security Eventlog Cleared
sigma_rule.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Potentially Suspicious AccessMask Requested From LSASS
sigma_rule.description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask
sigma_rule.author: Roberto Rodriguez, Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Dimitrios Slamaris, Mark Russinovich, Aleksey Potapov, oscd.community (update)

sigma_rule.title: LSASS Access From Non System Account
sigma_rule.description: Detects potential mimikatz-like tools accessing LSASS from non system account
sigma_rule.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

sigma_rule.title: Protected Storage Service Access
sigma_rule.description: Detects access to a protected_storage service over the network. Potential abuse of DPAPI to extract domain backup keys from Domain Controllers
sigma_rule.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

sigma_rule.title: Potentially Suspicious GrantedAccess Flags On LSASS
sigma_rule.description: Detects process access requests to LSASS process with potentially suspicious access flags
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth, Roberto Rodriguez, Dimitrios Slamaris, Mark Russinovich, Thomas Patzke, Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Sherif Eldeeb, James Dickenson, Aleksey Potapov, oscd.community

sigma_rule.title: MSSQL Server Failed Logon
sigma_rule.description: Detects failed logon attempts from clients to MSSQL server.
sigma_rule.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), j4son

sigma_rule.title: Malicious PowerShell Keywords
sigma_rule.description: Detects keywords from well-known PowerShell exploitation frameworks
sigma_rule.author: Sean Metcalf (source), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

logsource.definition: Requirements: Script Block Logging must be enabled

sigma_rule.title: Important Windows Eventlog Cleared

sigma_rule.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution

sigma_rule.title: Hacktool Execution - Imphash
sigma_rule.description: Detects the execution of different Windows based hacktools via their import hash (imphash) even if the files have been renamed
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: LSASS Dump Keyword In CommandLine
sigma_rule.description: Detects the presence of the keywords "lsass" and ".dmp" in the commandline, which could indicate a potential attempt to dump or create a dump of the lsass process.
sigma_rule.author: E.M. Anhaus, Tony Lambert, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: RunMRU Registry Key Deletion - Registry
sigma_rule.description:
Detects attempts to delete the RunMRU registry key, which stores the history of commands executed via the run dialog.
In the clickfix techniques, the phishing lures instruct users to open a run dialog through (Win + R) and execute malicious commands.
Adversaries may delete this key to cover their tracks after executing commands.
sigma_rule.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: LSASS Process Memory Dump Files
sigma_rule.description: Detects creation of files with names used by different memory dumping tools to create a memory dump of the LSASS process memory, which contains user credentials.
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Uncommon Svchost Parent Process
sigma_rule.description: Detects an uncommon svchost parent process
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Security Eventlog Cleared
sigma_rule.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Security Eventlog Cleared
sigma_rule.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Suspicious Process Access to LSASS with Dbgcore/Dbghelp DLLs
sigma_rule.description:
Detects suspicious process access to LSASS.exe from processes located in uncommon locations with dbgcore.dll or dbghelp.dll in the call trace.
These DLLs contain functions like MiniDumpWriteDump that can be abused for credential dumping purposes. While modern tools like Mimikatz have moved to using ntdll.dll,
dbgcore.dll and dbghelp.dll are still used by basic credential dumping utilities and legacy tools for LSASS memory access and process suspension techniques.
sigma_rule.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: LSASS Process Memory Dump Files
sigma_rule.description: Detects creation of files with names used by different memory dumping tools to create a memory dump of the LSASS process memory, which contains user credentials.
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: HackTool - Dumpert Process Dumper Default File
sigma_rule.description: Detects the creation of the default dump file used by Outflank Dumpert tool. A process dumper, which dumps the lsass process memory
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Suspicious Process Access to LSASS with Dbgcore/Dbghelp DLLs
sigma_rule.description:
Detects suspicious process access to LSASS.exe from processes located in uncommon locations with dbgcore.dll or dbghelp.dll in the call trace.
These DLLs contain functions like MiniDumpWriteDump that can be abused for credential dumping purposes. While modern tools like Mimikatz have moved to using ntdll.dll,
dbgcore.dll and dbghelp.dll are still used by basic credential dumping utilities and legacy tools for LSASS memory access and process suspension techniques.
sigma_rule.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: LSASS Process Memory Dump Files
sigma_rule.description: Detects creation of files with names used by different memory dumping tools to create a memory dump of the LSASS process memory, which contains user credentials.

sigma_rule.description: Detects suspicious and uncommon child processes of WmiPrvSE
sigma_rule.author: Vadim Khrykov (ThreatIntel), Cyb3rEng, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Potentially Suspicious Rundll32 Activity
sigma_rule.description: Detects suspicious execution of rundll32, with specific calls to some DLLs with known LOLBIN functionalities
sigma_rule.author: juju4, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: WmiPrvSE Spawned A Process
sigma_rule.description: Detects WmiPrvSE spawning a process
sigma_rule.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

sigma_rule.title: HackTool - Generic Process Access
sigma_rule.description: Detects process access requests from hacktool processes based on their default image name
sigma_rule.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

sigma_rule.title: Potential Credential Dumping Via LSASS Process Clone
sigma_rule.description: Detects a suspicious LSASS process process clone that could be a sign of credential dumping activity
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Samir Bousseaden

sigma_rule.title: Process Memory Dump via RdrLeakDiag.EXE
sigma_rule.description: Detects the use of the Microsoft Windows Resource Leak Diagnostic tool "rdrleakdiag.exe" to dump process memory
sigma_rule.author: Cedric MAURUGEON, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Successful Overpass the Hash Attempt
sigma_rule.description: Detects successful logon with logon type 9 (NewCredentials) which matches the Overpass the Hash behavior of e.g Mimikatz's sekurlsa::pth module.
sigma_rule.author: Roberto Rodriguez (source), Dominik Schaudel (rule)

sigma_rule.title: Pass the Hash Activity 2
sigma_rule.description: Detects the attack technique pass the hash which is used to move laterally inside the network
sigma_rule.author: Dave Kennedy, Jeff Warren (method) / David Vassallo (rule)

logsource.definition: The successful use of PtH for lateral movement between workstations would trigger event ID 4624

sigma_rule.title: Outgoing Logon with New Credentials
sigma_rule.description: Detects logon events that specify new credentials
sigma_rule.author: Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution

sigma_rule.title: Suspicious File Characteristics Due to Missing Fields
sigma_rule.description: Detects Executables in the Downloads folder without FileVersion,Description,Product,Company likely created with py2exe
sigma_rule.author: Markus Neis, Sander Wiebing

sigma_rule.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution

sigma_rule.title: Unsigned DLL Loaded by Windows Utility
sigma_rule.description:
Detects windows utilities loading an unsigned or untrusted DLL.
Adversaries often abuse those programs to proxy execution of malicious code.
sigma_rule.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

sigma_rule.title: Potential Direct Syscall of NtOpenProcess
sigma_rule.description: Detects potential calls to NtOpenProcess directly from NTDLL.
sigma_rule.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems), Tim Shelton (FP)

sigma_rule.title: RunMRU Registry Key Deletion - Registry
sigma_rule.description:
Detects attempts to delete the RunMRU registry key, which stores the history of commands executed via the run dialog.
In the clickfix techniques, the phishing lures instruct users to open a run dialog through (Win + R) and execute malicious commands.
Adversaries may delete this key to cover their tracks after executing commands.
sigma_rule.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Uncommon Svchost Command Line Parameter
sigma_rule.description:
Detects instances of svchost.exe running with an unusual or uncommon command line parameter by excluding known legitimate or common patterns.
This could point at a file masquerading as svchost, a process injection, or hollowing of a legitimate svchost instance.
sigma_rule.author: Liran Ravich

sigma_rule.title: Uncommon Svchost Parent Process
sigma_rule.description: Detects an uncommon svchost parent process
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: New PortProxy Registry Entry Added
sigma_rule.description: Detects the modification of the PortProxy registry key which is used for port forwarding.
sigma_rule.author: Andreas Hunkeler (@Karneades)

sigma_rule.title: Trust Access Disable For VBApplications
sigma_rule.description: Detects registry changes to Microsoft Office "AccessVBOM" to a value of "1" which disables trust access for VBA on the victim machine and lets attackers execute malicious macros without any Microsoft Office warnings.
sigma_rule.author: Trent Liffick (@tliffick), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Uncommon Child Process Of Conhost.EXE
sigma_rule.description: Detects uncommon "conhost" child processes. This could be a sign of "conhost" usage as a LOLBIN or potential process injection activity.
sigma_rule.author: omkar72

sigma_rule.title: HackTool - Generic Process Access
sigma_rule.description: Detects process access requests from hacktool processes based on their default image name
sigma_rule.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

sigma_rule.title: Potential WWlib.DLL Sideloading
sigma_rule.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "wwlib.dll"
sigma_rule.author: X__Junior (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: RDP Sensitive Settings Changed
sigma_rule.description:
Detects tampering of RDP Terminal Service/Server sensitive settings.
Such as allowing unauthorized users access to a system via the 'fAllowUnsolicited' or enabling RDP via 'fDenyTSConnections', etc.

Below is a list of registry keys/values that are monitored by this rule:

- Shadow: Used to enable Remote Desktop shadowing, which allows an administrator to view or control a user's session.
- DisableRemoteDesktopAntiAlias: Disables anti-aliasing for remote desktop sessions.
- DisableSecuritySettings: Disables certain security settings for Remote Desktop connections.
- fAllowUnsolicited: Allows unsolicited remote assistance offers.
- fAllowUnsolicitedFullControl: Allows unsolicited remote assistance offers with full control.
- InitialProgram: Specifies a program to run automatically when a user logs on to a remote computer.
- ServiceDll: Used in RDP hijacking techniques to specify a custom DLL to be loaded by the Terminal Services service.
- SecurityLayer: Specifies the security layer used for RDP connections.
sigma_rule.author: Samir Bousseaden, David ANDRE, Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Nasreddine Bencherchali

sigma_rule.title: RDP Sensitive Settings Changed to Zero
sigma_rule.description:
Detects tampering of RDP Terminal Service/Server sensitive settings.
Such as allowing unauthorized users access to a system via the 'fAllowUnsolicited' or enabling RDP via 'fDenyTSConnections', etc.
sigma_rule.author: Samir Bousseaden, David ANDRE, Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Nasreddine Bencherchali

sigma_rule.title: ServiceDll Hijack
sigma_rule.description:
Detects changes to the "ServiceDLL" value related to a service in the registry.
This is often used as a method of persistence.
sigma_rule.author: frack113

sigma_rule.title: Suspicious Startup Folder Persistence
sigma_rule.description:
Detects the creation of potentially malicious script and executable files in Windows startup folders, which is a common persistence technique used by threat actors.
These files (.ps1, .vbs, .js, .bat, etc.) are automatically executed when a user logs in, making the Startup folder an attractive target for attackers.
This technique is frequently observed in malvertising campaigns and malware distribution where attackers attempt to maintain long-term access to compromised systems.
sigma_rule.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: AD Privileged Users or Groups Reconnaissance
sigma_rule.description: Detect priv users or groups recon based on 4661 eventid and known privileged users or groups SIDs
sigma_rule.author: Samir Bousseaden

logsource.definition: Requirements: enable Object Access SAM on your Domain Controllers

sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Jack Croock (method), Jonhnathan Ribeiro (improvements), oscd.community

logsource.definition: The volume of Event ID 4661 is high on Domain Controllers and therefore "Audit SAM" and "Audit Kernel Object" advanced audit policy settings are not configured in the recommendations for server systems

sigma_rule.description: Detects the presence of the keywords "Wscript", "Shell" and "Run" in the command, which could indicate a suspicious activity
sigma_rule.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Suspicious Process Parents
sigma_rule.description: Detects suspicious parent processes that should not have any children or should only have a single possible child program
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Bad Opsec Defaults Sacrificial Processes With Improper Arguments
sigma_rule.description:
Detects attackers using tooling with bad opsec defaults.
E.g. spawning a sacrificial process to inject a capability into the process without taking into account how the process is normally run.
One trivial example of this is using rundll32.exe without arguments as a sacrificial process (default in CS, now highlighted by c2lint), running WerFault without arguments (Kraken - credit am0nsec), and other examples.
sigma_rule.author: Oleg Kolesnikov @securonix invrep_de, oscd.community, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Suspicious Command Patterns In Scheduled Task Creation
sigma_rule.description: Detects scheduled task creation using "schtasks" that contain potentially suspicious or uncommon commands
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.description: Detects the presence of the keywords "Wscript", "Shell" and "Run" in the command, which could indicate a suspicious activity

sigma_rule.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Successful Overpass the Hash Attempt
sigma_rule.description: Detects successful logon with logon type 9 (NewCredentials) which matches the Overpass the Hash behavior of e.g Mimikatz's sekurlsa::pth module.
sigma_rule.author: Roberto Rodriguez (source), Dominik Schaudel (rule)

sigma_rule.title: Pass the Hash Activity 2
sigma_rule.description: Detects the attack technique pass the hash which is used to move laterally inside the network
sigma_rule.author: Dave Kennedy, Jeff Warren (method) / David Vassallo (rule)

logsource.definition: The successful use of PtH for lateral movement between workstations would trigger event ID 4624

sigma_rule.title: Outgoing Logon with New Credentials
sigma_rule.description: Detects logon events that specify new credentials
sigma_rule.author: Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Potential LethalHTA Technique Execution
sigma_rule.description: Detects potential LethalHTA technique where the "mshta.exe" is spawned by an "svchost.exe" process
sigma_rule.author: Markus Neis

sigma_rule.title: Remote PowerShell Session Host Process (WinRM)
sigma_rule.description: Detects remote PowerShell sections by monitoring for wsmprovhost (WinRM host process) as a parent or child process (sign of an active PowerShell remote session).
sigma_rule.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

sigma_rule.title: AD Privileged Users or Groups Reconnaissance
sigma_rule.description: Detect priv users or groups recon based on 4661 eventid and known privileged users or groups SIDs
sigma_rule.author: Samir Bousseaden

logsource.definition: Requirements: enable Object Access SAM on your Domain Controllers

sigma_rule.title: Security Eventlog Cleared
sigma_rule.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Reconnaissance Activity
sigma_rule.description: Detects activity as "net user administrator /domain" and "net group domain admins /domain"
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Jack Croock (method), Jonhnathan Ribeiro (improvements), oscd.community

logsource.definition: The volume of Event ID 4661 is high on Domain Controllers and therefore "Audit SAM" and "Audit Kernel Object" advanced audit policy settings are not configured in the recommendations for server systems

sigma_rule.title: Security Eventlog Cleared
sigma_rule.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Suspicious Redirection to Local Admin Share
sigma_rule.description: Detects a suspicious output redirection to the local admins share, this technique is often found in malicious scripts or hacktool stagers
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: HackTool - Potential Impacket Lateral Movement Activity
sigma_rule.description: Detects wmiexec/dcomexec/atexec/smbexec from Impacket framework
sigma_rule.author: Ecco, oscd.community, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Tim Rauch

sigma_rule.title: DLL Load via LSASS
sigma_rule.description: Detects a method to load DLL via LSASS process using an undocumented Registry key
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Suspicious PsExec Execution
sigma_rule.description: detects execution of psexec or paexec with renamed service name, this rule helps to filter out the noise if psexec is used for legit purposes or if attacker uses a different psexec client other than sysinternal one
sigma_rule.author: Samir Bousseaden

logsource.definition: The advanced audit policy setting "Object Access > Audit Detailed File Share" must be configured for Success/Failure

sigma_rule.title: RunMRU Registry Key Deletion - Registry
sigma_rule.description:
Detects attempts to delete the RunMRU registry key, which stores the history of commands executed via the run dialog.
In the clickfix techniques, the phishing lures instruct users to open a run dialog through (Win + R) and execute malicious commands.
Adversaries may delete this key to cover their tracks after executing commands.
sigma_rule.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: RunMRU Registry Key Deletion - Registry
sigma_rule.description:
Detects attempts to delete the RunMRU registry key, which stores the history of commands executed via the run dialog.
In the clickfix techniques, the phishing lures instruct users to open a run dialog through (Win + R) and execute malicious commands.
Adversaries may delete this key to cover their tracks after executing commands.
sigma_rule.author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Suspicious SYSTEM User Process Creation
sigma_rule.description: Detects a suspicious process creation as SYSTEM user (suspicious program or command line parameter)
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), David ANDRE (additional keywords)

sigma_rule.title: Potential CobaltStrike Service Installations - Registry
sigma_rule.description: Detects known malicious service installs that appear in cases in which a Cobalt Strike beacon elevates privileges or lateral movement.
sigma_rule.author: Wojciech Lesicki

sigma_rule.title: Gzip Archive Decode Via PowerShell
sigma_rule.description: Detects attempts of decoding encoded Gzip archives via PowerShell.
sigma_rule.author: Hieu Tran

sigma_rule.title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Specific - ProcessCreation
sigma_rule.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters
sigma_rule.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Hijack Legit RDP Session to Move Laterally
sigma_rule.description: Detects the usage of tsclient share to place a backdoor on the RDP source machine's startup folder
sigma_rule.author: Samir Bousseaden

sigma_rule.title: Potential Lateral Movement via Windows Remote Shell
sigma_rule.description: Detects a child process spawned by 'winrshost.exe', which suggests remote command execution through Windows Remote Shell (WinRs) and may indicate potential lateral movement activity.
sigma_rule.author: Liran Ravich

sigma_rule.title: Suspicious WmiPrvSE Child Process
sigma_rule.description: Detects suspicious and uncommon child processes of WmiPrvSE
sigma_rule.author: Vadim Khrykov (ThreatIntel), Cyb3rEng, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Potentially Suspicious Rundll32 Activity
sigma_rule.description: Detects suspicious execution of rundll32, with specific calls to some DLLs with known LOLBIN functionalities
sigma_rule.author: juju4, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: WmiPrvSE Spawned A Process
sigma_rule.description: Detects WmiPrvSE spawning a process
sigma_rule.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

sigma_rule.title: Suspicious Redirection to Local Admin Share
sigma_rule.description: Detects a suspicious output redirection to the local admins share, this technique is often found in malicious scripts or hacktool stagers
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: HackTool - Potential Impacket Lateral Movement Activity
sigma_rule.description: Detects wmiexec/dcomexec/atexec/smbexec from Impacket framework
sigma_rule.author: Ecco, oscd.community, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Tim Rauch

sigma_rule.title: WmiPrvSE Spawned A Process
sigma_rule.description: Detects WmiPrvSE spawning a process
sigma_rule.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g

sigma_rule.title: Uncommon Svchost Parent Process
sigma_rule.description: Detects an uncommon svchost parent process
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Malicious Named Pipe Created
sigma_rule.description: Detects the creation of a named pipe seen used by known APTs or malware.
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), blueteam0ps, elhoim

logsource.definition: Note that you have to configure logging for Named Pipe Events in Sysmon config (Event ID 17 and Event ID 18). The basic configuration is in popular sysmon configuration (https://github.com/SwiftOnSecurity/sysmon-config), but it is worth verifying. You can also use other repo, e.g. https://github.com/Neo23x0/sysmon-config, https://github.com/olafhartong/sysmon-modular. How to test detection? You can check powershell script from this site https://svch0st.medium.com/guide-to-named-pipes-and-hunting-for-cobalt-strike-pipes-dc46b2c5f575

sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Mimikatz DC Sync
sigma_rule.description: Detects Mimikatz DC sync security events

sigma_rule.title: Security Eventlog Cleared
sigma_rule.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution

sigma_rule.title: Modify User Shell Folders Startup Value
sigma_rule.description:
Detect modification of the User Shell Folders registry values for Startup or Common Startup which could indicate persistence attempts.
Attackers may modify User Shell Folders registry keys to point to malicious executables or scripts that will be executed during startup.
This technique is often used to maintain persistence on a compromised system by ensuring that the malicious payload is executed automatically.
sigma_rule.author: frack113, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Suspicious SYSTEM User Process Creation
sigma_rule.description: Detects a suspicious process creation as SYSTEM user (suspicious program or command line parameter)
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), David ANDRE (additional keywords)

sigma_rule.title: Registry Modification to Hidden File Extension
sigma_rule.description: Hides the file extension through modification of the registry
sigma_rule.author: frack113

sigma_rule.title: Potential Persistence Via Shim Database Modification
sigma_rule.description:
Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by application shims.
The Microsoft Windows Application Compatibility Infrastructure/Framework (Application Shim) was created to allow for backward compatibility of software as the operating system codebase changes over time
sigma_rule.author: frack113

sigma_rule.title: New Custom Shim Database Created
sigma_rule.description:
Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by application shims.
The Microsoft Windows Application Compatibility Infrastructure/Framework (Application Shim) was created to allow for backward compatibility of software as the operating system codebase changes over time.
sigma_rule.author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Suspicious Process Parents
sigma_rule.description: Detects suspicious parent processes that should not have any children or should only have a single possible child program
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Potentially Suspicious Event Viewer Child Process
sigma_rule.description: Detects uncommon or suspicious child processes of "eventvwr.exe" which might indicate a UAC bypass attempt
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Unusual Parent Process For Cmd.EXE
sigma_rule.description: Detects suspicious parent process for cmd.exe
sigma_rule.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)

sigma_rule.title: Shell Open Registry Keys Manipulation
sigma_rule.description: Detects the shell open key manipulation (exefile and ms-settings) used for persistence and the pattern of UAC Bypass using fodhelper.exe, computerdefaults.exe, slui.exe via registry keys (e.g. UACMe 33 or 62)
sigma_rule.author: Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Bypass UAC Using DelegateExecute
sigma_rule.description: Bypasses User Account Control using a fileless method
sigma_rule.author: frack113

sigma_rule.title: Bypass UAC Using SilentCleanup Task
sigma_rule.description:
Detects the setting of the environement variable "windir" to a non default value.
Attackers often abuse this variable in order to trigger a UAC bypass via the "SilentCleanup" task.
The SilentCleanup task located in %windir%\system32\cleanmgr.exe is an auto-elevated task that can be abused to elevate any file with administrator privileges without prompting UAC.
sigma_rule.author: frack113, Nextron Systems

sigma_rule.title: UAC Bypass via Windows Firewall Snap-In Hijack
sigma_rule.description: Detects attempts to bypass User Account Control (UAC) by hijacking the Microsoft Management Console (MMC) Windows Firewall snap-in
sigma_rule.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)

sigma_rule.title: CMSTP UAC Bypass via COM Object Access
sigma_rule.description: Detects UAC Bypass Attempt Using Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer Autoelevate-capable COM Objects (e.g. UACMe ID of 41, 43, 58 or 65)
sigma_rule.author: Nik Seetharaman, Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Unusual Parent Process For Cmd.EXE
sigma_rule.description: Detects suspicious parent process for cmd.exe
sigma_rule.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)

sigma_rule.title: Bypass UAC Using SilentCleanup Task
sigma_rule.description:
Detects the setting of the environement variable "windir" to a non default value.
Attackers often abuse this variable in order to trigger a UAC bypass via the "SilentCleanup" task.
The SilentCleanup task located in %windir%\system32\cleanmgr.exe is an auto-elevated task that can be abused to elevate any file with administrator privileges without prompting UAC.

sigma_rule.description: Detects suspicious service installation commands
sigma_rule.author: pH-T (Nextron Systems), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Meterpreter or Cobalt Strike Getsystem Service Installation - System
sigma_rule.description: Detects the use of getsystem Meterpreter/Cobalt Strike command by detecting a specific service installation
sigma_rule.author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Ecco, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Uncommon Service Installation Image Path
sigma_rule.description: Detects uncommon service installation commands by looking at suspicious or uncommon image path values containing references to encoded powershell commands, temporary paths, etc.
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Windows Binaries Write Suspicious Extensions
sigma_rule.description: Detects Windows executables that write files with suspicious extensions
sigma_rule.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Hacktool Execution - Imphash
sigma_rule.description: Detects the execution of different Windows based hacktools via their import hash (imphash) even if the files have been renamed
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Uncommon Svchost Parent Process
sigma_rule.description: Detects an uncommon svchost parent process
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Network Connection Initiated Via Notepad.EXE
sigma_rule.description:
Detects a network connection that is initiated by the "notepad.exe" process.
This might be a sign of process injection from a beacon process or something similar.
Notepad rarely initiates a network communication except when printing documents for example.
sigma_rule.author: EagleEye Team

sigma_rule.title: Rare Remote Thread Creation By Uncommon Source Image
sigma_rule.description: Detects uncommon processes creating remote threads.
sigma_rule.author: Perez Diego (@darkquassar), oscd.community

sigma_rule.title: Non Interactive PowerShell Process Spawned
sigma_rule.description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.
sigma_rule.author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g (rule), oscd.community (improvements)

sigma_rule.title: Potentially Suspicious Execution From Parent Process In Public Folder
sigma_rule.description: Detects a potentially suspicious execution of a parent process located in the "\Users\Public" folder executing a child process containing references to shell or scripting binaries and commandlines.
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Suspicious Child Process Of Wermgr.EXE
sigma_rule.description: Detects suspicious Windows Error Reporting manager (wermgr.exe) child process

sigma_rule.description: Detects suspicious parent process for cmd.exe
sigma_rule.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)

sigma_rule.description: Detects Executables in the Downloads folder without FileVersion,Description,Product,Company likely created with py2exe

sigma_rule.description: Detects an uncommon svchost parent process
sigma_rule.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Potential Defense Evasion Via Binary Rename
sigma_rule.description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.

sigma_rule.description: Detects the execution of the "wusa.exe" (Windows Update Standalone Installer) utility to extract ".cab" files using the "/extract" argument from potentially suspicious paths.
sigma_rule.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Unusual Parent Process For Cmd.EXE
sigma_rule.description: Detects suspicious parent process for cmd.exe
sigma_rule.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)

sigma_rule.title: PsExec Tool Execution From Suspicious Locations - PipeName
sigma_rule.description: Detects PsExec default pipe creation where the image executed is located in a suspicious location. Which could indicate that the tool is being used in an attack
sigma_rule.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

logsource.definition: Note that you have to configure logging for Named Pipe Events in Sysmon config (Event ID 17 and Event ID 18). The basic configuration is in popular sysmon configuration (https://github.com/SwiftOnSecurity/sysmon-config), but it is worth verifying. You can also use other repo, e.g. https://github.com/Neo23x0/sysmon-config, https://github.com/olafhartong/sysmon-modular. How to test detection? You can check powershell script from this site https://svch0st.medium.com/guide-to-named-pipes-and-hunting-for-cobalt-strike-pipes-dc46b2c5f575

sigma_rule.title: Potential System DLL Sideloading From Non System Locations
sigma_rule.description: Detects DLL sideloading of DLLs usually located in system locations (System32, SysWOW64, etc.).
sigma_rule.author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_rule.title: Suspicious Binaries and Scripts in Public Folder
sigma_rule.description: Detects the creation of a file with a suspicious extension in the public folder, which could indicate potential malicious activity.
sigma_rule.author: The DFIR Report

sigma_rule.title: Unusual Parent Process For Cmd.EXE
sigma_rule.description: Detects suspicious parent process for cmd.exe
sigma_rule.author: Tim Rauch, Elastic (idea)
